title: 108_s2479
content: Elections for Thrift Savings Plan contributions. The Thrift Savings Plan Open Elections Act of 2004 allows federal employees to make contributions to their Thrift Savings Plan at any time, with the election taking effect as soon as administratively feasible and remaining in effect until modified or terminated. The Thrift Savings Plan Open Elections Act of 2004 allows federal employees to delay contributions until the date they would have started under previous regulations. Amendments were made to the Civil Service Retirement System participation. Amendments to various sections of title 5, United States Code, were made to allow previously ineligible employees to contribute to the Thrift Savings Plan. Information provision requirements were also updated to be on a regular basis. Amendments were made to various sections of title 5, United States Code, allowing previously ineligible employees to contribute to the Thrift Savings Plan on a regular basis. Amendments to title 5, United States Code allow uniformed services members to contribute to the Thrift Savings Plan regularly. SEC. 2. ENHANCING FINANCIAL LITERACY. The Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board evaluates tools for participants to understand financial products in the Thrift Savings Plan and improves education programs. They report annually on their efforts to the Senate and House committees. The Office of Personnel Management provides retirement training in consultation with the Board. The Office, in consultation with the Board, will develop a retirement financial literacy strategy for Federal employees within 6 months of the Act's enactment. This strategy aims to educate employees on retirement savings, provide information on planning for retirement, and submit a report to the Senate and House committees. The Senate passed the legislation on July 16, 2004.
